titleStmt.title: A new (and too true) description of England: briefly delineating the [brace] carefull condition of the court. Cautious policy of the head city. Callamitous case of the country. And cruell passages of the campe. In a familier dialogue, betweene, Chrystopher a cavalier, and Barnaby a caviller. / Written by (now I thinke on't) tis no matter who. But it affords, more witt then words.
titleStmt.author: Wither, George, 1588-1667,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to George Wither in the Wrenn catalogue.
The words "Carefull . country" and "Cruell .. campe" are enclosed in brackets on the title page.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
